action.action-desc: Mr. Kustoff (for himself and Ms. Chu) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to modify the rules for postponing certain deadlines by reason of disaster.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Filing Relief for Natural Disasters Act.

section.header: Modification of rules for postponing certain deadlines by reason of disaster

subsection.header: Authority To postpone Federal tax deadlines by reason of State-Declared disasters
subsection.text: Section 7508A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by redesignating subsections (c), (d), and (e) as subsections (d), (e), and (f), respectively, and by inserting after subsection (b) the following new subsection:

paragraph.text: Upon the written request of the Governor of a State (or the Mayor, in the case of the District of Columbia) in which an emergency or disaster has been declared under State law, subsection (a) shall apply to such State-declared emergency or disaster in the same manner as such subsections apply to federally declared disasters.

For purposes of this section, the term State includes the District of Columbia, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, American Samoa, and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands.
